result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl A Evrard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $12,750.00 and restitution surcharge. Cash bail to be applied to restitution.
-------------------------------

Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision fees.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-------------------------------

No contact with victim's family.
-------------------------------
No alcohol or illegal drugs or possession of drug paraphernalia.
-------------------------------
Maintain sobriety.
-------------------------------

Mental health counseling.
-------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-------------------------------

IT IS ORDERED and ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on February 28, 2018, that: 

IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of the circuit court is summarily affirmed pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Jeremy Newman is relieved of further representation of Carl Evard in this matter.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Jeremy Newman is relieved of further representation of Carl Evrard in this matter.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: BOND QUASHED
Temporary Commitment form filed

3:45 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Atty Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Carl A Evrard in court, in custody with Atty Travis Schwantes.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  Court has reviewed the file including the PSI and the victim impact statement.  Atty Schwantes has reviewed the PSI with his client and recites corrections to the report.  Defendant would not be eligible for CIP or SAP for this offense.  
3:48 pm  State has complied with the victim notification and consultation law.  The victim has some family and friends present but no one who wishes to speak.  Court notes there is a restitution request on file.  
Court makes record as to its understanding of the plea agreement.  State will cap its sentencing recommendation at 8 years IC and 12 years ES.  
3:50 pm  Argument as to sentence by Atty Johnson.  
4:00 pm  Argument as to sentence by Atty Schwantes.  
4:25 pm  Statement by Mr. Evrard.  
4:26 pm  Court takes recess to consider this matter and will return at 4:45 with a decision.  
4:45 pm  Court in session.  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the Defendant.  

Court imposes following sentence:
Total length of sentence is 20 years
8 yrs IC followed by 12 yrs ES
386 days of sentence credit to be applied
NOT eligible for CIP or SAP

Conditions of ES:  
1)  No contact with victim's family.  2)  Maintain sobriety.  3) No alcohol or illegal drugs or possession of drug paraphernalia.  4)  Mental health counseling.  5)  AODA treatment as recommended.  6)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  7)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  8)  Pay restitution in the amount of $12,750.00 - cash bail to be applied toward restitution.  

Court gives warnings:  Not to possess firearms; not to vote; not to possess body armor

4:55 pm  Court in recess.

TOTAL BOND COVERS 15CF138 AND 15GF514
Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.E.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
